alert.note: Alert for Madison; Northern Oneida; Onondaga (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 05 at 4:48PM EDT by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of western Oneida, northwestern Madison and central Onondaga Counties through 530 PM EDT... At 448 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Marcellus, or 10 miles east of Auburn, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Onondaga, Syracuse, De Witt, Sullivan, Lenox, Pompey, North Syracuse, Solvay, Chittenango and Canastota. This includes the following highway exits... Interstate 90 between 34 and 37. New York Interstate 81 between 16A and 28. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
